newsitem.title: USA: Wesley Jessen cites demand, sets expansion.
newsitem.headline: Wesley Jessen cites demand, sets expansion.

text.p: Wesley Jessen VisionCare Inc said Wednesday it is accelerating plans for expansion of a manufacturing facility in Des Plaines, Ill. because of stronger than expected growth of the disposable lens business.
Company officials were not available to provide details of the expansion plans.
Earlier today the company reported 1997 first quarter adjusted earnings rose 13.2 percent from the same period a year ago to $3.6 million or $0.18 a share.
Net sales for the three months ended March 29, 1997, increased 112.5 percent to $64.1 million, reflecting the October 1996 acquisition of Barnes Hind operations.

"We are pleased with Wesley Jessen's first quarter results, which reflect stronger than expected revenue trends, solid operating margin improvement and net income performance which is markedly better than our plan," said President and Chief Executive Officer Kevin Ryan in a statement.
Wesley Jessen develops, makes and markets specialty soft contact lenses. The company completed its initial public offering of common stock in February, 1997.
Shares of Wesley Jessen were trading up 1/4 to 16-7/8.
